results.title: Grand Théâtre Fantasmagorique shadow play set
results.brief_description: Shadow play sets used decorative paper puppets to cast short fables and fairytales. Popular in China for over 2000 years, they were later merged with other innovations, like magic lanterns, to project ghoulish phantasmagoria shows.

constellations_primary.name: Spooky shadows
constellations_primary.description: Hellish and hilarious vampires connect pioneering German cinema to contemporary New Zealand comedy with a quick detour into small town strangeness.

results.description:
Shadow puppetry has been popular in China for more than 2,000 years. Invented to entertain Emperor Wu of the Han dynasty, shadow plays were transported to Europe by travellers in the mid-18th century. There they were known as ombres chinoises (Chinese shadows) and were adapted to tell European stories. Puppeteer François Dominique Séraphin made them popular when he presented them in Paris in 1776, and by 1781 he was dazzling the court at the Palace of Versailles. Even Marie Antoinette admired his work.

Shadow play sets like this one used decorative paper puppets to cast short fables and fairytales. Later they were merged with other innovations, like magic lanterns, to project ghoulish phantasmagoria shows.

Even Marie Antoinette admired his work.

results.title: Cyber sisters
results.creator_credit: Declan Eames, Stuart Menzies, Tony Wright and December Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “Grey voyagers”.
72 year old Catherine Walshe overcomes depression and agoraphobia to visit the friends she has made via the Internet. Travelling from her home in Ireland she meets her ‘cyber sisters’ and joins them on a spectacular journey across the United States by train. Catherine begins to rebuild her life as she shares the sights of Niagara Falls, the mid-western prairies and the vastness of the Rocky Mountains with her friends.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Declan Eames, Stuart Menzies, Tony Wright and December Films

results.title: Father's footsteps
results.creator_credit: Erika Addis, Stuart Menzies, Tony Wright and December Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Grey voyagers”.
80 year old Coffs Harbour identical twins Toni and Adelie Hurley travel to Antarctica on a voyage commemorating Ernest Shackleton’s ill-fated expedition of 1914-16. Their father, Australian director and cinematographer Frank Hurley, was the official photographer aboard the ‘Endurance’ which was crushed by ice as it approached Antarctica, leaving the entire crew stranded on the flows for 6 months. Forced to take to the open sea in 3 small boats when the ice broke, the crew eventually landed on uninhabited Elephant Island and remained there until Shackleton organised their rescue. Toni and Adelie recount their memories of their father as they return to the region where he struggled to survive. During their voyage, they discuss their father’s photographs and diary with Jonathon Shackleton, a relative of the Irish explorer, as they approach Elephant Island. Adelie Hurley also talks about her own career, and her status as Australia’s first female press photographer. Cinematography by Erika Addis. Edited by Tony Stevens. Narrated by Anne Phelan.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Erika Addis, Stuart Menzies, Tony Wright and December Films

results.title: Iranian nights
results.creator_credit: Susan Lambert, Stuart Menzies, Tony Wright and December Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “Grey voyagers”.
66 year old American emigre Louise Firouz lives and works in the remote north eastern corner of Iran. She breeds rare Turkoman horses, and co-ordinates exotic adventure treks into ancient and remote landscapes which attract international visitors. Two Australian women in their late 60s, Nelly Gelich and her friend Joan Beslich, join Louise and her entourage on a trek which follows a path dating back to Alexander the Great. Along the way, they encounter Kurdish nomads whose hospitality and lifestyle have remained unchanged for centuries.

results.title: Flying Dutchmen
results.creator_credit: Steve Westh, Stuart Menzies, Tony Wright and December Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Grey voyagers”.
65 year old Jan van Hulsen teams up Fred van`t Riet to sail a 37 foot yacht from Guatemala to Australia. Hindered by poor weather, delays and clashes of opinion, they don’t travel much further than the Caribbean. Still grieving the recent death of his wife, Jan perseveres through the loneliness and hardship to chart a new direction in his life.

results.title: Born to ride
results.creator_credit: Steve Westh, Catherine Marciniak, Stuart Menzies, Tony Wright and December Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Grey voyagers”.
Mechanic Doug Sunderland has been riding motorbikes for 60 years. At 75 years of age, he sets out on a journey to ride through India and Nepal, overcoming ill-health and a collision to celebrate the new Millennium and 2 million kilometres in the saddle. During his voyage, he recounts the 6 years he spent in an orphanage, suggesting it fueled his desire to seek nature and open spaces. Doug also visits Rumtek Monastery in Sikkim. Cinematography by Catherine Marciniak. Edited by Tony Stevens. Narrated by Anne Phelan.

results.title: Mavis goes to Timor
results.creator_credit: Catherine Marciniak, Steve Westh, Stuart Menzies, Tony Wright and December Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Grey voyagers”.
86 year old Mavis Taylor travels from Yarrawonga to East Timor on her first trip overseas. Against the odds, she plans to establish a sewing co-operative for the local women. Frustrated by bureaucracy, Mavis seeks assistance from the local community to help her transform an abandoned hospital into a warehouse and training centre for the co-operative. Her determination and perseverance is rewarded when the first order arrives and a group of local women are trained and organised to meet the delivery deadline. The project provides an opportunity for the women to establish economic security and independence for themselves and their community. During her stay in East Timor, Mavis also visits a church whose congregation was massacred by the Indonesian militia. Cinematography by Catherine Marciniak. Edited by Andrea Lang. Narrated by Anne Phelan.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Catherine Marciniak, Steve Westh, Stuart Menzies, Tony Wright and December Films

results.title: Man and woman
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Great Themes of Literature”.
This film, edited from Zeffirelli’s lusty version of Shakespeare’s “Taming of the Shrew”, unfurls with great fun a Renaissance version of the spectacle known as ‘the battle of the sexes’. Stars Richard Burton and Elizabeth Taylor. As the commentator points out the dramatising violent conflict between men and women in search of love is one way that world literature has dealt with the relationship between the sexes.
